p: After completion of wound healing test, rats were sacrificed. Samples of the previously injured tissue were removed at 3, 7, 14, and 21 days. The incision area and adjacent normal skin were excised for each sacrificed animal. Half of every sample fixed in 10% formalin for histological analysis, and the other half was frozen in liquid nitrogen for enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) test.
